Class ChatSkill

ChatSkill offers a more coherent chat experience by using memories to extract conversation history and user intentions.

ChatAsync(String, SKContext)

This is the entry point for getting a chat response. It manages the token limit, saves messages to memory, and fill in the necessary context variables for completing the prompt that will be rendered by the template engine.

Declaration
[SKFunction("Get chat response", false)]
[SKFunctionName("Chat")]
[SKFunctionInput(Description = "The new message")]
[SKFunctionContextParameter(Name = "userId", Description = "Unique and persistent identifier for the user")]
[SKFunctionContextParameter(Name = "userName", Description = "Name of the user")]
[SKFunctionContextParameter(Name = "chatId", Description = "Unique and persistent identifier for the chat")]
[SKFunctionContextParameter(Name = "proposedPlan", Description = "Previously proposed plan that is approved")]
public async Task<SKContext> ChatAsync(string message, SKContext context)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String message

The message.
Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Orchestration.SKContext context

Contains the 'tokenLimit' and the 'contextTokenLimit' controlling the length of the prompt.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Orchestration.SKContext>

A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing the asynchronous operation.
